jobs.title: Benefits Consultant (KS)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

Current healthcare solutions for employers are limited, low-tech, and difficult to administer. Angle Health's products are built for the modern employer, saving them time, helping to keep their employees healthy, and enabling everyone to spend more time doing the things that matter—creating value and building the company—and less time trying to figure out health insurance.


Our Sales Team is responsible for bringing Angle Health Plans to every business, employee, and person in the country. As a Consultant for Angle Health, you will develop and build relationships with potential customers and clients through a variety of channels. As the first line of communication with prospects, you have a strong understanding of the sales process or a strong desire to learn and exceed in sales. You are a quick learner with strong communication skills, someone who easily picks up and loves to share new technology, and you thrive off meeting and learning about others. Every connection is an opportunity for you to drive revenue growth, and customer acquisition, and directly impact the success of our company.


The ideal candidates for this role will be eager, ambitious, competitive, and driven to start a rewarding career. Sales experience is not a requirement if you are a highly motivated individual with a desire to learn and succeed. This position will require around 50% travel to meet with customers and potential customers within your assigned market. 

We expect this person to be based in Kansas or Missouri, with a preference for candidates in Kansas City.

Core Responsibilities

  • Proactively engage with potential customers within your market to increase top-of-funnel candidates

  • Develop and maintain deep knowledge about Angle Health's products and platform, those of our competitors, and the healthcare and health insurance industry

  • Communicate Angle’s offerings clearly and compelling through language and live demos, and identify how our solutions meet prospective customers’ needs

  • Maintain positive and constant communication with clients to ensure client satisfaction 

  • Must be willing to travel to meet with clients, however, some office time is required to meet successful goals

  • Coordinate and actively shepherd groups through the sales cycle, including proposals, underwriting, contract negotiations, and finalized policies

  • Work with your manager for ongoing training opportunities

  • Assist in coordinating events or attending events within the insurance space to broaden top-of-funnel opportunities and Angle Health’s market exposure

  • Engage with the insurance community to increase customer referrals and testimonials, and decrease customer churn rates

  • Collaborate with our internal teams to successfully drive sales and close new business

  • Continuously improve upon and exceed sales quotas

What We Value

  • Licensed Accident/Health Producer in good standing with home state within 90 days of hire

  • Highly organized, motivated, outcome-oriented, and target-driven

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to clearly and concisely articulate key value propositions and quickly build trust

  • Entrepreneurial, self-directed, and excited to build something from scratch

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • Driven to exceed expectations

  • A passion for bringing best-in-class products to solve problems for and satisfy customers

Bonus Points

  • 1-2 years of experience in insurance, payroll, or a related field of sales 

  • Knowledge and experience with sales operations tools including LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRM Tools, and basic automation tools

  • Bachelor's Degree

The pay range for this job opportunity is $150,000 to $300,000 OTE + benefits, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

Because We Value You:

• Competitive compensation

• 100% company-paid comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance for you and your dependents 

• Supplemental Life, AD&D and Short-Term Disability coverage options 

• Discretionary time off 

• Opportunity for rapid career progression 

• 3 months of paid parental leave and flexible return to work policy (after 12 months of employment) 

• Work-from-home stipend for remote employees 

• 401(k) account 

• Other benefits are coming soon! 

About Us
Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. As part of this core group at Angle Health, you will have the right balance of support and autonomy to grow both personally and professionally and the opportunity to own large parts of the business and scale with the company. 

Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Angle Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. 

⚠️ A Note on Recruiting Outreach
We’ve been made aware of individuals falsely claiming to represent Angle Health using lookalike email addresses (like @anglehealthcareers.com). Please note that all legitimate emails from our team come from @anglehealth.com. We will never ask for sensitive information or conduct interviews via messaging apps.

jobs.title: Fullstack Software Engineer (NYC)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.


The Role

As an early fullstack engineer at Angle, you'll be at the forefront of building and launching products that directly impact both our members and internal teams. This role offers the opportunity to work across the stack—developing seamless user experiences, designing scalable APIs, and optimizing performance for mission-critical applications.

You’ll own full product lifecycles, from ideation and system design to implementation and iteration. Working closely with customers, designers, and non-technical stakeholders, you'll help shape intuitive solutions that solve complex challenges. Whether it's refining frontend interactions, optimizing backend logic, or architecting new features from scratch, your contributions will be instrumental in driving Angle’s success.

This is an ideal opportunity for engineers who love working on both frontend and backend, thrive in fast-paced environments, and want to see their work make a real-world impact. If you’re excited to build at scale and move quickly while maintaining high-quality engineering, we’d love to meet you.

This position is based in our NYC office.

Core Responsibilities

  • Build high-performing customer facing and internal products

  • Design and build delightful and innovative products that will be used by a wide variety of users

  • Write quality, performant, well-tested code in Python (Django), React, and Typescript

  • Drive technical projects from conception to launch, including architecture, design, implementation, testing, and deployment


Additionally, you

  • Will work directly with the Head of R&D to set the standard of high quality products

  • Are an independent working and self-starter

  • Seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our users

  • Are product minded – Willing to participate in product and engineering discussions


What We Value

  • 4+ years of fullstack engineering experience

  • Strong experience with React JS and TypeScript

  • Experience with Figma or similar design tools

  • Experience writing automated tests (unit tests, integration tests)

  • Strong Python experience

  • Experience in deploying and maintaining enterprise-scale applications in production

  • Familiar with building user-facing UIs

  • Excellent communication skills across teams

  • Strong foundation in designing and building web applications


The salary range for this job opportunity is $100,000 to $240,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.

  • Competitive compensation and stock options

  • 100% company-paid health, vision, and dental insurance — for you and your dependents

  • Supplemental Life, AD&D, and Short-Term Disability coverage options

  • Discretionary time off — take the time you need, when you need it

  • Opportunity for rapid career progression

  • 3 months of paid parental leave, plus a flexible return-to-work policy (after 12 months of employment)

  • Equinox membership, Monthly MetroCard, and Annual Citi Bike coverage for NYC office employees

  • 401(k) retirement savings plan

  • Company-provided lunch and dinner for in-office employees

  • More exciting benefits coming soon!

About Us
Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. As part of this core group at Angle Health, you will have the right balance of support and autonomy to grow both personally and professionally and the opportunity to own large parts of the business and scale with the company. 

Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Angle Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. 

⚠️ A Note on Recruiting Outreach
We’ve been made aware of individuals falsely claiming to represent Angle Health using lookalike email addresses (like @anglehealthcareers.com). Please note that all legitimate emails from our team come from @anglehealth.com. We will never ask for sensitive information or conduct interviews via messaging apps.

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer (NYC)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.


The Role
As an early engineer at Angle, you'll play a key role in architecting and scaling the core backend infrastructure that powers our healthcare platform. This is an opportunity to build systems from the ground up—designing APIs, structuring data models, and optimizing performance to support a high-growth company.

You'll work closely with product owners, designers, and other engineers to bring new features to life, ensuring our systems are both scalable and reliable. From architecting backend services to debugging performance bottlenecks, you’ll have full ownership of the product lifecycle—shaping everything from system design to implementation.

This role is perfect for engineers who love tackling complex problems in a fast-paced environment, enjoy working with cross-functional teams, and want to see their work directly impact the future of healthcare. If you're excited by the challenge of building high-performance backend systems at scale, we'd love to have you on board.

This position is based in our NYC office.

Core Responsibilities

  • Work directly with the Head of R&D in architecting and building Angle's backend infrastructure

  • Work with product owners & designers to build a scalable implementation process across multiple web products

  • Support the entire application lifecycle, including concept, design, test, release, and support phases

  • Build optimal backend applications that are performant at scale

  • Work together with the product leadership to plan new features

  • Oversee the compliance of applications with established quality standards

What We Value

  • 4+ years software engineering experience

  • Strong understanding of business context and a desire to connect engineering solutions to real-world problems, driving impactful outcomes for the company and its users

  • Strong engineering background in technical fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, and Physics

  • Familiarity with data structures, CI/CD, software development lifecycles, backend frameworks, and other technical tools

  • Demonstrated proficiency in Python and Django, experience with Java is a plus

  • Demonstrated ability to learn and work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision

  • A desire to be part of the journey to change the face of healthcare

  • Inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with

  • Are a passionate developer, proud of the quality of your work

The salary range for this job opportunity is $100,000 to $240,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.



Because We Value You:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options

  • 100% company-paid health, vision, and dental insurance — for you and your dependents

  • Supplemental Life, AD&D, and Short-Term Disability coverage options

  • Discretionary time off — take the time you need, when you need it

  • Opportunity for rapid career progression

  • 3 months of paid parental leave, plus a flexible return-to-work policy (after 12 months of employment)

  • Equinox membership, Monthly MetroCard, and Annual Citi Bike coverage for NYC office employees

  • 401(k) retirement savings plan

  • Company-provided lunch and dinner for in-office employees

  • More exciting benefits coming soon!

About Us
Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. As part of this core group at Angle Health, you will have the right balance of support and autonomy to grow both personally and professionally and the opportunity to own large parts of the business and scale with the company. 

Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Angle Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.

jobs.title: Technical Product Engineer (NYC)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role

We’re looking for a product-minded engineer to join our elite team of problem solvers tackling some of the hardest challenges across the business. If you’re an engineer first, but you also have the desire, aptitude, and ability to engage in product thinking—this role is for you.

As a Technical Product Engineer, you’ll work directly with operational stakeholders to deeply understand business workflows and build hands-on technical solutions that drive critical business outcomes. This may involve optimizing or replacing existing processes, developing critical workflows from scratch, or architecting robust data pipelines and infrastructure.

Your role will look more like a startup CTO than a traditional PM—you’ll be embedded in small, highly autonomous teams of engineers, data scientists, and other Technical Product Engineers, owning the end-to-end execution of high-impact projects. You’ll have a direct impact on mission-critical functions, from business development to customer operations to finance, legal, compliance, and beyond. Expect to dive deep into engineering challenges while staying plugged into business goals and strategy.

This role is ideal for engineers who want to continue writing code while solving high-value business problems with a product-first mindset. This position is based in our NYC office.

What We Value

  • A deep technical background with a few years of experience in software engineering, data science, or a similar hands-on technical role.

  • A highly analytical mindset and an eagerness to build technical solutions to complex business problems.

  • Strong programming skills—proficiency in Python, SQL, Java, TypeScript/JavaScript, or similar.

  • Experience with data analysis and manipulation to drive decision-making.

  • Intellectual curiosity—you're not satisfied with surface-level answers and always want to dive into the “how” and “why.”

  • Strong execution skills—you thrive in fast-moving, ambiguous environments where outcomes matter more than process.

  • Low ego—the best ideas win, regardless of where they come from.

  • The ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

This role is NOT for you if:

  • You want to be a traditional product manager—this role is hands-on engineering, not just writing specs and running standups.

  • You prefer working in highly structured environments with well-defined roadmaps and processes.

  • You don’t enjoy writing code or building technical solutions.

  • You don’t want to work in a high-ownership, high-autonomy role where you drive projects from end to end.

  • You prefer to just write code or pick up tickets instead of scoping projects and requirements end to end

The salary range for this job opportunity is $100,000 to $240,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.


Because We Value You:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options

  • 100% company-paid health, vision, and dental insurance — for you and your dependents

  • Supplemental Life, AD&D, and Short-Term Disability coverage options

  • Discretionary time off — take the time you need, when you need it

jobs.descriptionPlain:
Changing Healthcare For Good


At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role


We’re looking for a product-minded engineer to join our elite team of problem solvers tackling some of the hardest challenges across the business. If you’re an engineer first, but you also have the desire, aptitude, and ability to engage in product thinking—this role is for you.

As a Technical Product Engineer, you’ll work directly with operational stakeholders to deeply understand business workflows and build hands-on technical solutions that drive critical business outcomes. This may involve optimizing or replacing existing processes, developing critical workflows from scratch, or architecting robust data pipelines and infrastructure.

Your role will look more like a startup CTO than a traditional PM—you’ll be embedded in small, highly autonomous teams of engineers, data scientists, and other Technical Product Engineers, owning the end-to-end execution of high-impact projects. You’ll have a direct impact on mission-critical functions, from business development to customer operations to finance, legal, compliance, and beyond. Expect to dive deep into engineering challenges while staying plugged into business goals and strategy.

This role is ideal for engineers who want to continue writing code while solving high-value business problems with a product-first mindset. This position is based in our NYC office.

What We Value

 - A deep technical background with a few years of experience in software engineering, data science, or a similar hands-on technical role.

 - A highly analytical mindset and an eagerness to build technical solutions to complex business problems.

 - Strong programming skills—proficiency in Python, SQL, Java, TypeScript/JavaScript, or similar.

 - Experience with data analysis and manipulation to drive decision-making.

 - Intellectual curiosity—you're not satisfied with surface-level answers and always want to dive into the “how” and “why.”

 - Strong execution skills—you thrive in fast-moving, ambiguous environments where outcomes matter more than process.

 - Low ego—the best ideas win, regardless of where they come from.

 - The ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

This role is NOT for you if:

 - You want to be a traditional product manager—this role is hands-on engineering, not just writing specs and running standups.

 - You prefer working in highly structured environments with well-defined roadmaps and processes.

 - You don’t enjoy writing code or building technical solutions.

 - You don’t want to work in a high-ownership, high-autonomy role where you drive projects from end to end.

 - You prefer to just write code or pick up tickets instead of scoping projects and requirements end to end

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.


The Role
As an early engineer at Angle, you'll play a key role in architecting and scaling the core backend infrastructure that powers our healthcare platform. This is an opportunity to build systems from the ground up—designing APIs, structuring data models, and optimizing performance to support a high-growth company.

You'll work closely with product owners, designers, and other engineers to bring new features to life, ensuring our systems are both scalable and reliable. From architecting backend services to debugging performance bottlenecks, you’ll have full ownership of the product lifecycle—shaping everything from system design to implementation.

This role is perfect for engineers who love tackling complex problems in a fast-paced environment, enjoy working with cross-functional teams, and want to see their work directly impact the future of healthcare. If you're excited by the challenge of building high-performance backend systems at scale, we'd love to have you on board.

This position is remote within the US.

Core Responsibilities

  • Work directly with the Head of R&D in architecting and building Angle's backend infrastructure

  • Work with product owners & designers to build a scalable implementation process across multiple web products

  • Support the entire application lifecycle, including concept, design, test, release, and support phases

  • Build optimal backend applications that are performant at scale

  • Work together with the product leadership to plan new features

  • Oversee the compliance of applications with established quality standards

What We Value

  • 4+ years software engineering experience

  • Strong understanding of business context and a desire to connect engineering solutions to real-world problems, driving impactful outcomes for the company and its users

  • Strong engineering background in technical fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, and Physics

  • Familiarity with data structures, CI/CD, software development lifecycles, backend frameworks, and other technical tools

  • Demonstrated proficiency in Python and Django, experience with Java is a plus

  • Demonstrated ability to learn and work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision

  • A desire to be part of the journey to change the face of healthcare

  • Inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with

  • Are a passionate developer, proud of the quality of your work

The salary range for this job opportunity is $100,000 to $200,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.



Because We Value You:

jobs.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.


The Role

As an early fullstack engineer at Angle, you'll be at the forefront of building and launching products that directly impact both our members and internal teams. This role offers the opportunity to work across the stack—developing seamless user experiences, designing scalable APIs, and optimizing performance for mission-critical applications.

You’ll own full product lifecycles, from ideation and system design to implementation and iteration. Working closely with customers, designers, and non-technical stakeholders, you'll help shape intuitive solutions that solve complex challenges. Whether it's refining frontend interactions, optimizing backend logic, or architecting new features from scratch, your contributions will be instrumental in driving Angle’s success.

This is an ideal opportunity for engineers who love working on both frontend and backend, thrive in fast-paced environments, and want to see their work make a real-world impact. If you’re excited to build at scale and move quickly while maintaining high-quality engineering, we’d love to meet you.

This position is remote within the US.

Core Responsibilities

  • Build high-performing customer facing and internal products

  • Design and build delightful and innovative products that will be used by a wide variety of users

  • Write quality, performant, well-tested code in Python (Django), React, and Typescript

  • Drive technical projects from conception to launch, including architecture, design, implementation, testing, and deployment


Additionally, you

  • Will work directly with the Head of R&D to set the standard of high quality products

  • Are an independent working and self-starter

  • Seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our users

  • Are product minded – Willing to participate in product and engineering discussions


What We Value

  • 4+ years of fullstack engineering experience

  • Strong experience with React JS and TypeScript

  • Experience with Figma or similar design tools

  • Experience writing automated tests (unit tests, integration tests)

  • Strong Python experience

  • Experience in deploying and maintaining enterprise-scale applications in production

  • Familiar with building user-facing UIs

  • Excellent communication skills across teams

  • Strong foundation in designing and building web applications


The salary range for this job opportunity is $100,000 to $200,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.

  • Competitive compensation and stock options

  • 100% company-paid health, vision, and dental insurance — for you and your dependents

  • Supplemental Life, AD&D, and Short-Term Disability coverage options

  • Discretionary time off — take the time you need, when you need it

  • Opportunity for rapid career progression

  • 3 months of paid parental leave, plus a flexible return-to-work policy (after 12 months of employment)

  • Equinox membership, Monthly MetroCard, and Annual Citi Bike coverage for NYC office employees

  • 401(k) retirement savings plan

  • Company-provided lunch and dinner for in-office employees

  • More exciting benefits coming soon!

jobs.title: VP Channel Sales (MI, OH or IN)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

The VP of Channel Sales and consulting is responsible for setting the overall direction, vision, and strategy for increased member growth and retention for our consulting channels. The role will align sales processes and the team to drive revenue growth for Angle Health within large regional and national benefits consulting practices. The VP is responsible through the leadership of the team's benefit consultants to meet the team's KPIs.

We expect candidates to be based in Cleveland, Columbus, Cincinnati, Dayton, Detroit, or Lansing.

Core Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and execute a national partnerships strategy

  • Build and manage a pipeline of potential vendor solutions to enhance outcomes, increase margins, and/or drive top-line growth

  • Manage a team of sales professionals to achieve set goals

  • Establish and foster relationships with prospective partners and their key stakeholders

  • Proactively seek new vendor opportunities in the market & follow up on current vendor relations

  • Communicate Angle’s offerings and needs in a clear and compelling through language and live demos, and identify how our solutions can benefit our partners

  • Coordinate and actively manage the complete vendor lifecycle through internal and external relations

  • Develop and maintain deep knowledge about Angle Health's products and platform, and the healthcare and health insurance industry

  • Collaborate closely with commercial, product, finance, and technical teams

What We Value

  • Experience selling health plans

  • Licensed Accident/Health Producer in good standing with home state

  • Highly organized, motivated, outcome-oriented, and target-driven

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to clearly and concisely articulate key value propositions and quickly build trust

  • Entrepreneurial, self-directed, and excited to build something from scratch

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • Knowledge and experience with sales operations tools including LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRM Tools, and basic automation tools

  • A passion for bringing best-in-class products to solve problems for and satisfy customers

Because We Value You:

• Competitive compensation and stock options 

• 100% company-paid comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance for you and your dependents 

• Supplemental Life, AD&D and Short-Term Disability coverage options 

• Discretionary time off 

• Opportunity for rapid career progression 

• Relocation assistance (if relocation is required) 

• 3 months of paid parental leave and flexible return to work policy (after 12 months of employment) 

• Work-from-home stipend for remote employees 

• Company provided lunch for in-office employees 

• 401(k) account 

• Other benefits are coming soon! 

The pay range for this job opportunity is $150,000 to $175,000 salary with OTE $300,000 to $500,000 + equity + benefits, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.

jobs.title: Benefits Consultant (MO)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

Current healthcare solutions for employers are limited, low-tech, and difficult to administer. Angle Health's products are built for the modern employer, saving them time, helping to keep their employees healthy, and enabling everyone to spend more time doing the things that matter—creating value and building the company—and less time trying to figure out health insurance.


Our Sales Team is responsible for bringing Angle Health Plans to every business, employee, and person in the country. As a Consultant for Angle Health, you will develop and build relationships with potential customers and clients through a variety of channels. As the first line of communication with prospects, you have a strong understanding of the sales process or a strong desire to learn and exceed in sales. You are a quick learner with strong communication skills, someone who easily picks up and loves to share new technology, and you thrive off meeting and learning about others. Every connection is an opportunity for you to drive revenue growth, and customer acquisition, and directly impact the success of our company.


The ideal candidates for this role will be eager, ambitious, competitive, and driven to start a rewarding career. Sales experience is not a requirement if you are a highly motivated individual with a desire to learn and succeed. This position will require around 50% travel to meet with customers and potential customers within your assigned market. 

We expect this person to be based in Missouri, with a preference for candidates in St. Louis or Kansas City.

Core Responsibilities

  • Proactively engage with potential customers within your market to increase top-of-funnel candidates

  • Develop and maintain deep knowledge about Angle Health's products and platform, those of our competitors, and the healthcare and health insurance industry

  • Communicate Angle’s offerings clearly and compelling through language and live demos, and identify how our solutions meet prospective customers’ needs

  • Maintain positive and constant communication with clients to ensure client satisfaction 

  • Must be willing to travel to meet with clients, however, some office time is required to meet successful goals

  • Coordinate and actively shepherd groups through the sales cycle, including proposals, underwriting, contract negotiations, and finalized policies

  • Work with your manager for ongoing training opportunities

  • Assist in coordinating events or attending events within the insurance space to broaden top-of-funnel opportunities and Angle Health’s market exposure

  • Engage with the insurance community to increase customer referrals and testimonials, and decrease customer churn rates

  • Collaborate with our internal teams to successfully drive sales and close new business

  • Continuously improve upon and exceed sales quotas

What We Value

  • Licensed Accident/Health Producer in good standing with home state within 90 days of hire

  • Highly organized, motivated, outcome-oriented, and target-driven

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to clearly and concisely articulate key value propositions and quickly build trust

  • Entrepreneurial, self-directed, and excited to build something from scratch

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • Driven to exceed expectations

  • A passion for bringing best-in-class products to solve problems for and satisfy customers

Bonus Points

  • 1-2 years of experience in insurance, payroll, or a related field of sales 

  • Knowledge and experience with sales operations tools including LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRM Tools, and basic automation tools

  • Bachelor's Degree

The pay range for this job opportunity is $150,000 to $300,000 OTE + benefits, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

Because We Value You:

• Competitive compensation

• 100% company-paid comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance for you and your dependents 

• Supplemental Life, AD&D and Short-Term Disability coverage options 

• Discretionary time off 

• Opportunity for rapid career progression 

• 3 months of paid parental leave and flexible return to work policy (after 12 months of employment) 

• Work-from-home stipend for remote employees 

• 401(k) account 

• Other benefits are coming soon! 

About Us
Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobs.title: VP Channel Sales (TX)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

The VP of Channel Sales and consulting is responsible for setting the overall direction, vision, and strategy for increased member growth and retention for our consulting channels. The role will align sales processes and the team to drive revenue growth for Angle Health within large regional and national benefits consulting practices. The VP is responsible through the leadership of the team's benefit consultants to meet the team's KPIs.

We expect candidates to be based in Houston, San Antonio, Austin or Dallas-Fort Worth.

Core Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and execute a national partnerships strategy

  • Build and manage a pipeline of potential vendor solutions to enhance outcomes, increase margins, and/or drive top-line growth

  • Manage a team of sales professionals to achieve set goals

  • Establish and foster relationships with prospective partners and their key stakeholders

  • Proactively seek new vendor opportunities in the market & follow up on current vendor relations

  • Communicate Angle’s offerings and needs in a clear and compelling through language and live demos, and identify how our solutions can benefit our partners

  • Coordinate and actively manage the complete vendor lifecycle through internal and external relations

  • Develop and maintain deep knowledge about Angle Health's products and platform, and the healthcare and health insurance industry

  • Collaborate closely with commercial, product, finance, and technical teams

What We Value

  • Experience selling health plans

  • Licensed Accident/Health Producer in good standing with home state

  • Highly organized, motivated, outcome-oriented, and target-driven

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to clearly and concisely articulate key value propositions and quickly build trust

  • Entrepreneurial, self-directed, and excited to build something from scratch

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • Knowledge and experience with sales operations tools including LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRM Tools, and basic automation tools

  • A passion for bringing best-in-class products to solve problems for and satisfy customers

Because We Value You:

• Competitive compensation and stock options 

• 100% company-paid comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance for you and your dependents 

• Supplemental Life, AD&D and Short-Term Disability coverage options 

• Discretionary time off 

• Opportunity for rapid career progression 

• Relocation assistance (if relocation is required) 

• 3 months of paid parental leave and flexible return to work policy (after 12 months of employment) 

• Work-from-home stipend for remote employees 

• Company provided lunch for in-office employees 

• 401(k) account 

• Other benefits are coming soon! 

The pay range for this job opportunity is $150,000 to $175,000 salary with OTE $300,000 to $500,000 + equity + benefits, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.

Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Angle Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. 

⚠️ A Note on Recruiting Outreach
We’ve been made aware of individuals falsely claiming to represent Angle Health using lookalike email addresses (like @anglehealthcareers.com). Please note that all legitimate emails from our team come from @anglehealth.com. We will never ask for sensitive information or conduct interviews via messaging apps.

Our Sales Team is responsible for bringing Angle Health Plans to every business, employee, and person in the country. As a Consultant for Angle Health, you will develop and build relationships with potential customers and clients through a variety of channels. As the first line of communication with prospects, you have a strong understanding of the sales process or a strong desire to learn and exceed in sales. You are a quick learner with strong communication skills, someone who easily picks up and loves to share new technology, and you thrive off meeting and learning about others. Every connection is an opportunity for you to drive revenue growth, and customer acquisition, and directly impact the success of our company.

The ideal candidates for this role will be eager, ambitious, competitive, and driven to start a rewarding career. Sales experience is not a requirement if you are a highly motivated individual with a desire to learn and succeed. This position will require around 50% travel to meet with customers and potential customers within your assigned market of either Kansas/Missouri, Michigan/Ohio/Indiana, Florida or Texas.

Core Responsibilities

  • Proactively engage with potential customers within your market to increase top-of-funnel candidates

  • Develop and maintain deep knowledge about Angle Health's products and platform, those of our competitors, and the healthcare and health insurance industry

  • Communicate Angle’s offerings clearly and compelling through language and live demos, and identify how our solutions meet prospective customers’ needs

  • Maintain positive and constant communication with clients to ensure client satisfaction 

  • Must be willing to travel to meet with clients, however, some office time is required to meet successful goals

  • Coordinate and actively shepherd groups through the sales cycle, including proposals, underwriting, contract negotiations, and finalized policies

  • Work with your manager for ongoing training opportunities

  • Assist in coordinating events or attending events within the insurance space to broaden top-of-funnel opportunities and Angle Health’s market exposure

  • Engage with the insurance community to increase customer referrals and testimonials, and decrease customer churn rates

  • Collaborate with our internal teams to successfully drive sales and close new business

  • Continuously improve upon and exceed sales quotas

What We Value

  • Licensed Accident/Health Producer in good standing with home state within 90 days of hire

  • Highly organized, motivated, outcome-oriented, and target-driven

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to clearly and concisely articulate key value propositions and quickly build trust

  • Entrepreneurial, self-directed, and excited to build something from scratch

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • Driven to exceed expectations

  • A passion for bringing best-in-class products to solve problems for and satisfy customers

Bonus Points

  • 1-2 years of experience in insurance, payroll, or a related field of sales 

  • Knowledge and experience with sales operations tools including LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRM Tools, and basic automation tools

  • Bachelor's Degree

The pay range for this job opportunity is $150,000 to $300,000 OTE + benefits, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

Because We Value You:

• Competitive compensation

• 100% company-paid comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance for you and your dependents 

• Supplemental Life, AD&D and Short-Term Disability coverage options 

• Discretionary time off 

• Opportunity for rapid career progression 

• 3 months of paid parental leave and flexible return to work policy (after 12 months of employment) 

• Work-from-home stipend for remote employees 

• 401(k) account 

• Other benefits are coming soon! 

About Us
Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. As part of this core group at Angle Health, you will have the right balance of support and autonomy to grow both personally and professionally and the opportunity to own large parts of the business and scale with the company. 

Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Angle Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. 

⚠️ A Note on Recruiting Outreach
We’ve been made aware of individuals falsely claiming to represent Angle Health using lookalike email addresses (like @anglehealthcareers.com). Please note that all legitimate emails from our team come from @anglehealth.com. We will never ask for sensitive information or conduct interviews via messaging apps.

jobs.title: Business Systems Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

The Role

The Business Systems Analyst is a strategic partner responsible for shaping the technology and process architecture that drives business performance. In this role, you will own key decisions around system design, process improvements, and user experience enhancements. You will partner closely with business stakeholders, technical teams, and vendors to design, implement, and refine tools and processes that are scalable, efficient, and user-friendly. This role combines analytical rigor, strategic thinking, and product-focused design skills, including wireframing and UX/CX improvements, along with understanding of cloud-based infrastructure, to deliver solutions that align with organizational goals.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead business and technical architectural decision-making for critical business processes and systems, ensuring scalable and sustainable solutions.

  • Lead strategic initiatives to revamp and improve the end-to-end user experience for internal and external stakeholders.

  • Serve as a product-owner-style partner, eliciting business-level requirements, articulating system vision with wireframes, process diagrams, etc as needed, collaborating with technical resources to design, build, test, and launch solutions

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify, design, and implement technology solutions that support business strategy.

  • Analyze business processes to identify opportunities for strategic improvements and operational efficiency.

  • Develop and maintain documentation for systems architecture, workflows, and design decisions for both technical and business audiences.

  • Coordinate with vendors and internal technology teams to ensure alignment on system functionality, enhancements, and support.

  • Apply data analysis and metrics to inform strategic decisions, measure impact, and drive continuous improvement.

  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders, leveraging meetings, documentation, and digital collaboration tools.

  • Lead other initiatives and strategic projects as assigned.

What We Value

  • 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst; preferably in healthcare, insurance, digital health, employer benefits, and other related industries

  • Experience with software integration, system integration, and technologies used including SQL queries, APIs, sFTP, etc. 

  • Strong design and user experience skills, with proficiency in tools such as Figma, Balsamiq, or similar for creating wireframes, mockups, and process flows.

  • Solid conceptual thinking and analytical skills with the ability to provide resolution to problems of a moderate complexity

  • Creative curiosity and pragmatic innovation; understand current state and envision a path of improvement

  • Experience with Jira and Zendesk is a plus 

  • Experience with Javascript or other scripting language is a plus

The salary range for this job opportunity is $75,000 to $85,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

Because We Value You:

  • Competitive annual salary

  • 100% company-paid comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance for you and your dependents 

  • Supplemental Life, AD&D and Short-Term Disability coverage options 

  • Discretionary time off 

  • Opportunity for rapid career progression 

  • Relocation assistance (if relocation is required) 

  • 3 months of paid parental leave and flexible return to work policy (after 12 months of employment) 

  • Work-from-home stipend for remote employees 

  • 401(k) account 

  • Other benefits are coming soon! 

About Us
Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. jobs.title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Changing Healthcare For Good

At Angle Health, we believe the healthcare system should be accessible, transparent, and easy to navigate. As an AI-native, integrated healthcare company, we are replacing legacy systems with modern infrastructure to deliver members and patients the care they need when they need it. If you want to build the future of healthcare, we'd love for you to join us.

We at Angle Health are thrilled about expanding our finance and accounting team and are currently searching for a new team member. We are looking for individuals who are highly motivated and want to revolutionize the health insurance industry. This role will be responsible for managing the company’s incoming payments, ensuring accurate record-keeping, and maintaining effective communication with customers regarding billing and payment inquiries. The ideal candidate will possess a strong interest in health insurance, a bias toward action, and exceptional organizational and communication abilities. Our team moves quickly to make company-wide decisions, thus it is crucial to strike a balance between getting the details right while still moving fast. Finally, we are looking for someone eager to learn and grow with minimal supervision from senior staff.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Process and post incoming payments accurately and timely in the accounting system.

  • Prepare and send customer invoices and statements.

  • Monitor accounts to ensure payments are up to date.

  • Follow up on overdue accounts and initiate collection activities as necessary.

  • Reconcile accounts receivable ledger to ensure all payments are accounted for and properly posted.

  • Resolve customer billing disputes and discrepancies.

  • Prepare accounts receivable reports and summaries for management.

  • Collaborate with the sales and customer service teams to address billing and payment issues.

  • Maintain accurate and organized financial records.

  • Assist with month-end and year-end closing activities related to accounts receivable.

  • Comply with company policies and procedures as well as relevant accounting standards

  • While this role will be predominantly remote, we may require travel to our NYC office 1-3 times a quarter.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

  • 3+ years of experience in Accounts Receivable, Billing, or Collections

  • Basic knowledge of GAAP

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

  • Strong numeracy and analytical skills

The salary range for this job opportunity is $50,000 to $65,000 per year, which is the amount Angle Health anticipates paying for this position at the time of this job posting. The actual base salary offered may differ and will depend on various factors such as geographic location, skills, qualifications, and experience, as well as internal equity.

Backed by a team of world class investors, we are a healthcare startup on a mission to make our health system more effective, accessible, and affordable to everyone. From running large hospitals and health plans to serving on federal healthcare advisory boards to solving the world's hardest problems at Palantir, our team has done it all. As part of this core group at Angle Health, you will have the right balance of support and autonomy to grow both personally and professionally and the opportunity to own large parts of the business and scale with the company. 

Angle Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Angle Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.
